knitr::opts_chunk$set(message=F, warning=F)

library(glue)
library(stringr)

# Displays the macOS CMD button symbol (as a keyboard button)
macOSCmdButton <- function()
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output("\\keys{\\cmd}")
    }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output("<span class='key'>&#8984;</span>")
    }
  }

# Displays a label as a keyboard button
KeyboardButton <- function(label)
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output(paste0("\\keys{", label, "}"))
    }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output(glue("<span class='key'>{label}</span>"))
    }
  }

MarkdownSectionLabelToLaTeX <- function(label)
  {
  # convert text inside of ** pair into \textbf{}
  stringr::str_replace_all(label, "\\*\\*([\\w ]{1,})\\*\\*", "\\\\textbf{\\1}")
  }

# Displays a label inside of a "Warning" section
WarningSection <- function(label)
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output(paste(
      "\\begin{tcolorbox}[colframe=lightgray,colback=lightpink,arc=3mm]",
      "\n\\faExclamationTriangle \\textbf{Warning} \\newline\n",
      MarkdownSectionLabelToLaTeX(label), "\n\\end{tcolorbox}"))
    }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output(paste("::: {.warning}", label, ":::", sep="\n"))
    }
  }

# Displays a label inside of a "Tip" section
TipSection <- function(label)
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output(paste(
      "\\begin{tcolorbox}[colframe=lightgray,colback=lightyellow,arc=3mm]",
      "\n\\faLightbulb[regular] \\textbf{Tip} \\newline\n",
      MarkdownSectionLabelToLaTeX(label), "\n\\end{tcolorbox}"))
    }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output(paste("::: {.tip}", label, ":::", sep="\n"))
    }
  }

# Displays a label inside of a "Note" section
NoteSection <- function(label)
  {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output(paste(
      "\\begin{tcolorbox}[colframe=lightgray,colback=lightyellow,arc=3mm]",
      "\n\\faComment*[regular] \\textbf{Note} \\newline\n",
      MarkdownSectionLabelToLaTeX(label), "\n\\end{tcolorbox}"))
    }
  else if (knitr::is_html_output())
    {
    knitr::asis_output(paste("::: {.note}", label, ":::", sep="\n"))
    }
  }

This is preliminary documentation for an upcoming release of Readability Studio. If you have any feedback, please feel free to file an issue on [Github](https://github.com/Blake-Madden/ReadabilityStudioDocs). Thank you.

This book is a guide to using the software product **Readability Studio**, as well as a reference for readability formulas. For those interested in the formulas, please refer to the [English](#english-readability-tests), [Spanish](#spanish-readability-tests), and [German](#german-readability-tests) formula overviews. For further reading, refer to the [bibliography](#bibliography) for a concise list of articles discussing these formulas.
